channel.title: Getting online
channel.description: okay so i have followed almost every tutorial online. i have portforward correctly. i have made a no-ip and im hosting it. i have let port 43594 through my firewall. i have added the no-ip adress to my client and gui.java. i have done everything to get my server online but still cant. i really need help because i have been trying to get an answer for days and still cant find one. so if anyone out there can help me please help me out!!!! :(

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

okay so are you saying when you login that your using your no-ip? if so it may not work because it doesnt recognize you as the host so use 127.0.0.1 (host) and then for others to get on they have to use your no-ip

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @ppvagina ppvagina
item.description:
@ppvagina wrote:

umm yes it works when i use all the other ips such as my ip 0.0.0.0 127.0.0.1 but not when i use my no-ip.biz so im guessing the port is binded? i have no clue whats wrong maybe if someone would test it who is outside of my lan?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Is your server binded to the port you port forwarded?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @ppvagina ppvagina
item.description:
@ppvagina wrote:

okay i know i use 0.0.0.0 for mine and it says im connecting to my lan. and i know the no-ip is for others outside my lan. the thing is i dnt have anyone to test it outside of my lan. all i have is my computer that wont connect when i use the no-ip?

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

:fp: Thread number 14…

OT: 0.0.0.0 you use to connect to the server if you are running it on your computer, your no-ip for other people outside of your LAN. Make sure No-IPDuc is running and also make sure your server is running when you use canyouseeme.org.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @ppvagina ppvagina
item.description:
@ppvagina wrote:

yeah i already changed the host and trust me ive gone to every tutorial on youtube and google and cant find an answer. and utorrent slows my computer down a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: Getting online
item.dc:creator: @devenb123 devenb123
item.description:
@devenb123 wrote:

ok change the ip in client.java (client) to your no-ip host search for 127.0.0.1 or 0.0.0.0 or .no-ip and change it there

if still not worked go ctrl alt delete task manager 2nd tab turn on utorrent it should work OR reportforward OR follow another guide (youtube?)

Read full topic
